CatDescriptText: Alberta Thompson, Fifth Ward and Anne Perry, telephone company employee, Schenley Heights, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 24, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "What do you think is the major cause (or causes) of the increase in juvenile delinquency?" Alberta Thompson's answer reads: "I really think that it starts in the home with the parents.  If they stayed at home and gave their children guidance and help with their education and over the rough spots in school.  I think there would be much less juvenile delinquency...."  Anne Perry's answer reads: "There's not enough of Christianity in the family back-grounds, and there's a need for better home training, in general."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Alberta Thompson wearing plaid collared dress, standing in front of Sherwin-Williams store, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Anne Perry wearing dark short sleeve collared blouse, standing on sidewalk with buildings in background
